result.execSummary:
The defendant Ulysses A Tallie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing genitals to a child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $251.00 payable to Department of Justice, Department of Crime Victim Compensation.  To be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) Wis. stats and during Extended Supevision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Pay DNA surcharge, and all other applicable costs, surcharges and assessments.  To be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to Extended Supervision, but to remain a condition of Extended Supervision.

06-09-2016/ Judge Ellen R Brostrom
The Court ordered that the defendant is granted 231 days of sentence credit on count one.


Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain fulltime employment.  Vocational/educational training.

No drugs.
No contact with the victim or her family.

Cognitive behavior therapy.
Sexual offender assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with recommended treatment. Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay mandatory surcharge.
Court informs defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse program.; and that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearm/body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC for 15 years.

records.addlTxt: per order dated August 16, 2017, Appeal No. 2016AP1344CR, IT IS ORDERED that the motion for summary reversal is denied at this time. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this matter is stayed pending resolution of the petition for review in State v. Williams, No. 2016AP883CR, or, if review is granted, pending our supreme court's decision in that case. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that counsel for Tallie shall notify this court within five business days after final disposition of Williams by our supreme court. Counsel may, if warranted, review the request for summary reversal at that time.

per order dated March 7, 2017, Appeal No. 2016AP1344-CR, IT IS ORDERED that briefing in this case is stayed pending this Court's decision in State v. Williams, No. 2016AP883-CR, or State v. Perry, No. 2016AP558-CR.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the appellant's brief shall be filed no later than forty days from the date either State v. Williams, No. 2016AP883-CR, or State v. Perry, No. 2016AP558-CR, is decided.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (28 pages) commencing MARCH 23, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Ulysses A Tallie in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Ulysses A Tallie in custody not produced.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.

AS TO THE AMENDED COUNT 1:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: JLL. and Karen G.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  
3 1/2 YEARS  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0
DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 
1 1/2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is
2 YEARS.  Conditions of extended supervision:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Random urine screens.
*No drugs.
*No contact with the victim or her family.
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*Sexual Offender Assessment and comply with recommended treatment
*Pay all costs and surcharges
*Pay restitution in the amount of $251.00 payable to Department of Justice, Department of Crime Victim Compensation.

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.

The Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharge AND all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to extended supervision but remain a condition of extended supervision.

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC for 15 years. 

 Restitution is to be collected by the DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats. and during extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court informs defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms/body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into to the custody of the MIlwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed,
- Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
- Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;

Defendant Ulysses A Tallie in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Ulysses A Tallie in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO AMENDED INFORMATION:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of
Conviction.
Case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 10.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess firearms.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Same bail.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ulysses A Tallie in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Ulysses A Tallie in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Branch 38 for Branch 10. Case set for final pretrial. Amended Information filed charging one count exposing genitals or pubic area a Class I felony, pursuant to 948.10(1).  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court began plea colloquy with defendant. Defendant states that he needs additional time to consider entry of plea due to the courts discretion regarding sex offender registration. Case to remain on for trail in Branch 10 on 02-09-2015. Branch 10 notified plea not completed and case sent back to Branch 10 forthwith.
